p: Patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) are known to have a higher risk of upper respiratory tract infection and pneumonia due to their persistent proinflammatory state with functional defects in innate and adaptive immunity ( 5). No study so far has found that chronic kidney disease is statistically correlated with severe COVID-19. However, a significant association of CKD with severe COVID-19 was observed when data of different studies were combined ( 64).
